posts.content:
Finally have the bus back on the road. Gear selection ain't the best. But when warm will not go into 2nd. Looking for a replacement box. I fancy a freeway flyer as the engine is now a lot more powerful. Problem is I can't seem to find any for sale. Anyone know of a good supplier.
Thanks
Ronnie1

Sent from my SM-G950F using Tapatalk
Might help if you said what type of gearbox you had.

vwJim wrote:Might help if you said what type of gearbox you had.
Sorry it's a beetle 1303 irs box.

Sent from my SM-G950F using Tapatalk
Depending on exactly what's inside that box, you probably won't get much improvement

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
Probably easier and cheaper to just replace with another 1303s box. Plus your 4th gear has about the best for a lower cruising revs.
Send a pm to “onion” on here (Owen Warlow) as he usually has a few different boxes hanging about.
Or if the van is a keeper, speak to someone like Bears to find out how much to get yours rebuilt, that way you know it’s good for years to come.

Thanks for that. I will drop him line.

Sent from my SM-G950F using Tapatalk
Owen has more than a few, has anybody been down to his Gaff, mind boggling for sure
